Net-zero target means neutralising the impact of any residual emissions (after approximately 90-
95% of GHG emission reduction) by permanently removing an equivalent volume of CO (see the
2
definition of net-zero target above in the background). As such, neutralising more than 10% (e.g.
20%, as stated in the question) of carbon removals would not qualify to a claim of achieving a net-
zero target in accordance with the ESRS definition. As stated in ESRS E1 paragraph 60, the 90-95%
